summary: This document is a Know Your Customer (KYC) report for Jeffrey Epstein and his associated accounts at Deutsche Bank. It details the relationships, account ownership, and financial activities related to Epstein, including his connections to Paul Morris and Harry Beller. The report outlines the purpose of the accounts, expected inflows and outflows, and the nature of Epstein's wealth.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a current client of Deutsche Bank, seeking to open new accounts for managing funds related to his home in New York City.

persons.name: Paul Morris
persons.context: Paul Morris is the relationship manager for Jeffrey Epstein at Deutsche Bank, having previously worked with him at JP Morgan.

persons.name: Harry Beller
persons.context: Harry Beller is mentioned as a related party to Epstein's accounts, serving as an accountant.

connections.description: Paul Morris is the relationship manager for Jeffrey Epstein at Deutsche Bank, having previously established a connection while at JP Morgan.
Harry Beller is identified as an accountant related to Epstein's financial activities.

events.title: Account Opening for Neptune LLC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein opened a checking account and a money market account under Neptune LLC to manage expenses related to his home.

events.title: Client Meeting
events.description: A meeting took place between Paul Morris and Jeffrey Epstein to discuss the banking relationship.

locations: 6100 Red Hook, Quarter B3, St. Thomas 00802, USVI
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is a self-employed individual with a significant net worth estimated between $100 million and $500 million.
Epstein's primary source of wealth comes from his financial management firm and previous work at Bear Stearns.
The accounts opened for Neptune LLC are intended to manage the daily expenses of Epstein's home in NYC.
Paul Morris has known Epstein for several years and facilitated the transfer of funds from JP Morgan to Deutsche Bank.
Harry Beller is an accountant associated with Epstein, but negative media mentions regarding a different Harry Beller were clarified as unrelated.
